question: chemicals produced in one part of a plant that affect the growth and response of other parts
vanilla_rag_result: The chemicals produced in one part of a plant that affect the growth and response of other parts are called plant hormones. These hormones are vital to plant growth and influence various processes, including flowering, seed development, dormancy, and germination. They signal cells in different parts of the plant to respond accordingly, promoting and regulating growth, development, and differentiation of cells and tissues.
